author: Lisa Sakai Quinley
title: Nudibranchs in Full Color: Tracing Their Roots and Radiant Hues
subtitle: Nudibranchs in Full Color: Tracing Their Roots and Radiant Hues
description: An exploration of the Smithsonian Institution’s collection of nudibranchia, with an emphasis on their beauty and colors.

author: Annie Lee
title: Blooming Orchids
subtitle: Blooming Orchids
description: This interactive visualization explores orchid-pollinator relationships through different seasons and bloom characteristics. Scroll through the timeline and toggle between the filters to visualize how orchid characteristics like scent, flower count, and inflorescence vary across different pollinator groups and time of year.

author: Eva Lucy Alvarado
title: The Black Panther Party and the Post-Civil-Rights Era
subtitle: The Black Panther Party and the Post-Civil-Rights Era
description: Using the Smithsonian’s photographs, prints, and posters of the Black Panther Party and its members, this project seeks to demonstrate the BPP’s structure and tactics post-1968.

author: Sani Sharma
Ani Matevosian
title: Worn Worlds: A Textile Exhibition
subtitle: Worn Worlds: A Textile Exhibition
description: Bringing together textiles from the Freer & Sackler Galleries and the Cooper Hewitt Design Museum,  this project presents a vibrant tapestry of textile images that users can filter by continent, color, material, and technique. Each textile reveals metadata, including its origin and period, creating a historiographical tool to study the complexity of textiles.

author: Bella Kwon
Xuan Tan
title: Deep Sea Society
subtitle: Deep Sea Society
description: A tool organizing species of fish into a branching hierarchy based on their archetypes, linking scientific names to commonly understood common names. Sort of like a "Google Maps" for fish taxonomy, enabling users to trace evolutionary pathways, and understand classifications in a visually engaging format.

author: Nour Al Safadi
title: Within Politics
subtitle: Within Politics
description: Books, as cultural artifacts, carry rich narratives through their topics and metadata.  This visualization explores the political books in the Smithsonian Libraries, delving into their metadata to uncover how political themes intersect with other topics within the collection.

author: Tak Watanabe
title: Why Are Meteorites Found in Antarctica?
subtitle: Why Are Meteorites Found in Antarctica?
description: This project explores the intriguing relationship between meteorites and Antarctica, with a special focus on the Blue Ice Areas. It uses scrollytelling and map visualizations to present key insights.

author: Tak Watanabe
title: Uncover the Moment
subtitle: Uncover the Moment
description: This visualization aims to enrich portraits with narratives and stories using AI.

author: Josh Strupp
title: Piece by Piece
subtitle: Piece by Piece
description: Piece by Piece is an exploration of fashion at The Smithsonian. From thousands of images, users can curate their own closet, so to speak. Filter by country, decade, museum, and material to select clothing crops — extracted hats, shoes, trousers, and more — from artifacts. With your bespoke collection, mix and match to find the perfect arrangement, “exquisite corpse” style.

author: Daia Bromberg
title: Cutlery Chronicles
subtitle: Cutlery Chronicles
description: Cutlery Chronicles explores cutlery  within the Smithsonian collections with items from both the Cooper Hewitt Design Museum and the National Museum of American History. It includes two views- a photo gallery of the individual items with descriptions, and a timeline chart view with filters for different materials and types.

author: Katherine Chui
title: Searching Fashion by Color
subtitle: Searching Fashion by Color
description: Cutlery Chronicles explores cutlery  within the Smithsonian collections with items from both the Cooper Hewitt Design Museum and the National Museum of American History. It includes two views- a photo gallery of the individual items with descriptions, and a timeline chart view with filters for different materials and types.

author: Sophie Graves
title: Unearthed: An Exploration of the Gems in the Smithsonian’s Collection
subtitle: Unearthed: An Exploration of the Gems in the Smithsonian’s Collection
description: This project is an exploration of the gemstones in the National Museum of Natural History’s Gems & Minerals Collection, in four main parts. First, the information about gems and background of the collection itself. Second, an exploration of the colors of gemstones in the collection, explorable through type of gemstone. Third, an exploration of the origins of gemstones in the collection, explorable through type of gemstone & color of gemstone. Fourth, highlights from the collection, including information and statistics about notable pieces.

author: Harshita Chakravadhanula
title: Mint Matters
subtitle: Mint Matters
description: This visualisation looks into what makes a stamp valuable, and explores these facets through the smithsonian’s stamp collection.

author: Monsicha Srisuantang
title: The Greeting Cards
subtitle: The Greeting Cards
description: This project visualizes the collection of the greeting cards to explore the design elements, colors and occasions that make the cards memorable.

author: Steph Wu
Ian Yu
title: The Bleaching of Our Coral Reefs
subtitle: The Bleaching of Our Coral Reefs
description: This interactive visualization delves into the state of Pacific coral reefs using a dataset from NOAA. Drawing attention to the Smithsonian’s extensive and meticulously documented coral collection, we showcase images of Pacific coral species particularly impacted by significant bleaching events. The black-and-white color palette evokes a sense of urgency, symbolizing the potential loss of these stunning ecosystems and inspiring viewers to take action.
